intro: Batrachium paucistamineum f. radians, commonly known as the radiate batrachium, is a rare fern species native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that often display a distinctive radiating pattern. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories, where it thrives in high humidity and moderate light conditions. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing sorus, are clustered on the underside of the leaves, a common feature among ferns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
